snippet: Nasrin Sotoudeh ended her 49-day protest after judicial authorities agreed to lift a travel ban imposed on her 12-year-old daughter, her husband said.
abstract: Nasrin Sotoudeh, imprisoned Iranian human rights lawyer serving sentence for accusations of acting against national security, ends 49-day hunger strike after judicial authorities accede to her demand to lift travel ban imposed on her 12-year-old daughter; ruling seems to show that Iranian officials are receptive to pressure in human rights cases.
lead_paragraph: Nasrin Sotoudeh ended her 49-day protest after judicial authorities agreed to lift a travel ban imposed on her 12-year-old daughter, her husband said.

headline.seo: Nasrin Sotoudeh, Iranian Rights Advocate, Ends Hunger Strike
headline.main: Her Demand Met, Imprisoned Iranian Ends Hunger Strike
headline.print_headline: Her Demand Met, Imprisoned Iranian Ends Hunger Strike

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
